snippet: The governor of New York seemed to be caught off-guard when Republican legislators in Albany killed a plan to provide public financing for college courses in state prisons.
abstract: Editorial criticizes opposition to New York Gov Andrew Cuomo's announced plan to provide public financing for basic college-education programs in state prisons; cites evidence supporting the effectiveness of prison education; warns Cuomo that the program needs the stability of public financing.
lead_paragraph: The governor of New York seemed to be caught off-guard when Republican legislators in Albany killed a plan to provide public financing for college courses in state prisons.
